entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:31PM CDT until September 10 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR CENTRAL CHEYENNE COUNTY IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS HAS EXPIRED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been allowed to expire. However, small hail and gusty winds are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued September 09 at 4:44PM AST until September 11 at 8:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AST MONDAY... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves of 6 and 10 feet, and occasionally higher. * WHERE...Beaches along St Croix Eastern Half.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued September 09 at 4:44PM AST until September 13 at 6:00AM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet, and occasionally higher. * WHERE...for the USVI and adjacent islands. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through Tuesday night.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 7:28PM EDT until September 09 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL RANDOLPH COUNTY... At 728 PM EDT, Previous thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 6:43PM EDT until September 09 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Marion and Monongalia. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 6:42PM EDT until September 09 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN KANAWHA AND SOUTHWESTERN ROANE COUNTIES... At 642 PM EDT, Previous thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. Flash flooding has been reported in Frame. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:21PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Natrona and southeastern Washakie Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 520 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cottonwood Pass, which is also 35 miles northeast of Shoshoni, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:13PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN CAMPBELL AND NORTHWESTERN CROOK COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 513 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Rockypoint, or 42 miles northeast of Gillette, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Hot Springs and south central Washakie Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 500 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles east of Lucerne, which is also 18 miles east of Thermopolis, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.
